thread.title: Above normal temperatures, but wetter - Chicago Tribune
thread.title_full: Above normal temperatures, but wetter - Chicago Tribune

author: Tom Skilling
title: Above normal temperatures, but wetter - Chicago Tribune
text:
Computer models indicate that Chicago's temperatures will continue to exceed seasonal normals through the seven-day forecast cycle, but the pattern is gradually shifting to a wetter weather regime. Chicago has been experiencing dry conditions for three weeks. Since Oct. 1, the city has officially recorded only 0.18 inches of rain at O'Hare International Airport, but at least some rain is possible Friday afternoon through Saturday morning and heavier rain is likely Tuesday and Wednesday.
The latter system might include moisture from Hurricane Patricia, which is threatening portions of the Pacific Coast of southwestern Mexico. Texas, suffering from drought, has received heavy rains in recent days and, if forecasts come true, much more rain is expected Thursday through Monday.
